Posts.Title: Lousy Scan Results & Change to Xeloda /Tykerb Anita1969 EstherCA

Posts.Content: EstherCA wrote: How can I find out what facilities install a power port?  My veins are getting so bad, they are often unable to access them for scans, MRI's or pet scans.  I have had a regular port in my inner right arm for over 4 years now and it is still working fine, but I would like to get a new power port installed, so that it can be used to access for scans as well. If anyone has had a power port installed in Southern CA, that would be really great to know as well. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Power Port EstherCA KiminJax

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2008 08:37PM EstherCA wrote: Thanks for the input, the only reason I would switch out the port I have now for a power port would be to be able to do MRI's, and all pet/ct scans through it. Sounds like not all power ports are equal, or that not all facilities are willing to use.  I will have to ask more questions, it does seem that Bard makes quite a few different ports. My veins have become so impossible to find, that I end up getting stuck over and over again every time I need to get dye injected for a scan.  Since at stage 4 this will continue to happen, I am hoping there is a version of the power port that can be used for ALL dyes and scans, including PET scans.
Posts.Title: Power Port EstherCA KiminJax
